content.rendered:
Lifeline Wisdom Dental strives to make sure that your child’s dental health is a priority and their smiles are always heart-warming and beautiful!

 

We, at Lifeline Wisdom Dental, provide services for your entire family including children. The sooner you start bringing your child to regular dentist appointments, the better their dental health will remain throughout their lives.

 

  • Healthy gums and teeth
    • Regular check-ups ensure that your child’s dental health is strong.
  • Good dental habits
    • We teach your child the importance of good oral hygiene by brushing and flossing.
  • Relaxed and fun appointments
    • Our dentists strive to make appointments fun and easy for children
  • Great Smile
    • We can identify any problems early so your child’s smile is always beautiful.

 

When to bring your child to the dentist?

We encourage you to keep good oral health a priority in your child’s life. A child’s first tooth emerges at around six month’s old and over the next 12-13 years, these baby teeth will fall out and be replaced by the permanent set of teeth. Your child’s first dental visit is recommended by 12 months of age or within 6 months of the first tooth erupting. The visit includes a full exam of the teeth, jaws, bite and gums. It is your responsibility as a parent to provide your child with proper dental care so that your child’s smile is attractive and their teeth and gums are healthy.

 

Benefits of regular children’s appointments:

  • Any problems are caught on early and be addressed accordingly.
  • Regular check-ups make certain that any cavities are filled and oral hygiene is being up kept.
  • Can also help in identifying any future problems before the permanent set of teeth pushes its way in that they are aligned correctly and your child will not face any serious problems in the future.

 

Lifeline Wisdom Dental offers the following services:

  • Detailed check ups
  • Fillings and extractions for decayed teeth
  • Scaling and cleaning to prevent tartar build up
  • Advice on the maintenance of good oral health

 

What to expect at your child’s appointment with Lifeline Wisdom Dental

  • Our dentists will carry out a complete check-up including assessing their overall health and oral health. X-rays may also be taken to detect any future problems.
  • Cleaning and scaling may be done and a fluoride treatment may also be carried out as required.
  • Your child will also be advised on the importance of keeping good oral health by avoiding sugary drinks and food, brushing their teeth and flossing twice a day.

 

 

 

 

Tips for brushing your child’s teeth

  • Try to make brushing fun for your child and attach it to an activity like playing a song while brushing on their devices so that they slowly brush their teeth well for the prescribed 2 minutes.
  • Kids under the age of 7 years are advised to use a ‘pea-sized’ amount of toothpaste to brush their teeth.
